table.name: rate_geo_stops
table.description: More granular than RATE_OFFERING_STOPS, this table indicates the number of stops that are included in the rate before the carrier starts to charge extra.  While RATE_OFFERING_STOPS has this information for a contract in general, this table relates the information to a particular geo (lane).

columns.name: RATE_GEO_GID
columns.description: The GID for the rate geo.

columns.name: LOW_STOP
columns.description: Stop off charges are typically defined for truckload rates. In most cases, the base rate includes the pickup stop and the first delivery stop. The rate may also support the option of performing addition stops, but at an additional per stop charge. The additional per stop charges are often specified in a ranges i.e., for stops 3 to 5 the per stop charge is X for stops 6 to 7 the per stop charge is Y per stop. The low stop fields defines the low end of the range for stop off charges.

columns.name: HIGH_STOP
columns.description: Stop off charges are typically defined for truckload rates. In most cases, the base rate includes the pickup stop and the first delivery stop. The rate may also support the option of performing addition stops, but at an additional per stop charge. The additional per stop charges are often specified in a ranges i.e., for stops 3 to 5 the per stop charge is X for stops 6 to 7 the per stop charge is Y per stop. The high stop field defines the high end of the range for stop off charges.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST
columns.description: The per stop charge for the low high range being defined.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST_GID
columns.description: The GID for the per stop cost.

columns.name: PER_STOP_COST_BASE
columns.description: The per stop cost in base units.

columns.name: DOMAIN_NAME
columns.description: Database domain where this data is stored.

columns.name: INSERT_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data insert user.

columns.name: INSERT_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of data insert.

columns.name: UPDATE_USER
columns.description: The user ID of the data update user.

columns.name: UPDATE_DATE
columns.description: Date and time of the most recent data update.
